rules: Rule1: If network TV airs the public health show, then public alcohol consumption does not increase liver disease cases
Rule2: Network TV airs the public health show or online platforms stream the public health show
Rule3: If online platforms stream the public health show, then public alcohol consumption does not increase liver disease cases
Rule4: The health agency monitors alcohol consumption trends or the health agency reviews alcohol consumption data

Rule5: If the health agency reviews alcohol consumption data, then either the health agency launches an alternative entertainment program or, given that the health agency enforces advertising restrictions, reduced alcohol consumption lowers public health risk

Rule6: The health agency proposes new legislation or, should the monitoring of alcohol consumption trends by the health agency not lead to either the launching of an alternative entertainment program by the health agency or the enforcement of advertising restrictions by the health agency resulting in reduced alcohol consumption lowering public health risk, then the health agency issues a public health warning
Rule7: If Congress rejects the new legislation, then the health agency does not propose new legislation
Rule8: If the public health department maintains current funding, then the public health department has funding for an awareness campaign
Rule9: If the public health department continues existing programs, then the public health department maintains current funding
Rule10: The health agency implements emergency measures or hospital admissions for alcohol-related cases do not rise
Rule11: If the government declares a public health emergency, then the health agency does not implement emergency measures
Rule12: The government declares a public health emergency or the government activates emergency powers
Rule13: If the government activates emergency powers, then the health agency does not implement emergency measures
Rule14: Congress passes the alcohol tax bill or the president approves the alcohol tax bill
Rule15: If the president approves the alcohol tax bill, then reduced alcohol consumption lowers public health risk
Rule16: If Congress introduces the alcohol tax bill, then should Congress pass the alcohol tax bill, reduced alcohol consumption lowers public health risk
Rule17: Congress introduces the alcohol tax bill or the president supports the alcohol tax bill
Rule18: If the state government implements an alcohol ban, then public alcohol consumption increases liver disease cases
Rule19: The state government implements an alcohol ban or reduced alcohol consumption lowers public health risk
Rule20: If public alcohol consumption increases liver disease cases, then hospital admissions for alcohol-related cases rise

Rule21: Under the condition that the monitoring of alcohol consumption trends by the health agency does not lead to either the launching of an alternative entertainment program by the health agency or the enforcement of advertising restrictions by the health agency resulting in reduced alcohol consumption lowering public health risk, then the health agency does not issue a public health warning

Rule22: If the support of the alcohol tax bill by the president does not result in the passing of the alcohol tax bill by Congress leading to reduced alcohol consumption lowering public health risk, then the alcohol industry receives tax credits

Rule23: Should the failure of reduced alcohol consumption to lower public health risk not lead to the public health department having funding for an awareness campaign, then the alcohol industry receives government subsidies

Rule24: Given that the failure of reduced alcohol consumption to lower public health risk does not result in the public health department having funding for an awareness campaign, then the alcohol industry does not receive government subsidies
Rule25: If reduced alcohol consumption does not lower public health risk, then the public health department continues existing programs
Rule26: If reduced alcohol consumption does not lower public health risk, then the public health department does not have funding for an awareness campaign
facts: Fact1: The health agency enforces advertising restrictions
Fact2: Congress rejects the new legislation
Fact3: The health agency does not launch an alternative entertainment program
Fact4: The alcohol industry does not receive tax credits

question: Reduced alcohol consumption lowers public health risk
